Name: Johann Albrecht Adelgrief
Death: Executed after claiming to be a prophet.[6]

Name: Marigje Arriens
Death: Burned to death for sorcery.

Name: Goodwife Bassett[7]
Death: Accused but not executed because she was pregnant. (Husband John Proctor Jr was executed for being a Witch) Elizabeth died sometime after 1703. The cause is unknown but not from Witch trials.

Name: Allison Balfour
Death: Executed in Kirkwall

Name: Agnes Bernauer
Death: Convicted of witchcraft and thrown in the Danube to drown, following accusations by her father-in-law Ernest, Duke of Bavaria.

Name: Merga Bien
Death: Convicted as part of the Fulda witch trials and burned to death.

Name: Lasses Birgitta
Death: The first woman executed for witchcraft in Sweden; beheaded.

Name: Bridget Bishop
Death: The first person to be tried and executed during the Salem witch trials.[8]

Name: Viola Cantini
Death: Burned to death on May 10, 1693, after caught performing vampirism on her dying son and cursing members of the village.[citation needed]

Name: Sidonia von Borcke
Death: Confessed to murder and witchcraft under torture; beheaded, corpse burned.

Name: Janet Boyman
Death: Executed in 1572 for witchcraft

Name: George Burroughs
Death: Congregational pastor, executed as part of the Salem witch trials.[9]

Name: Martha Carrier
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials; her children had claimed she was a witch while undergoing torture.

Name: Anne de Chantraine
Death: Strangled and then burned at the stake.

Name: Michée Chauderon
Death: Confessed under torture to summoning demons and was the last person executed for sorcery in Geneva.[10]

Name: Nyzette Cheveron
Death: Confessed to being a witch; was strangled and burned to death.

Name: Elizabeth Clarke
Death: The first woman persecuted by the Witchfinder General, Matthew Hopkins; hanged.

Name: Giles Corey
Death: Crushed to death for refusing to plea during the Salem witch trials. This method is also known as pressing. His last words were "more weight please".

Name: Martha Corey
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials

Name: Helena Curtens
Death: One of the last people to be executed for witchcraft in Germany.

Name: Narbona Dacal
Death: Accused of witchcraft during the trial by the Inquisition. Burned at the stake.

Name: Jean Delvaux
Death: Roman Catholic monk; beheaded

Name: Catherine Deshayes
Death: AKA La Voisin; burned to death following the Affair of the Poisons

Name: Thomas Doughty
Death: Nobleman and explorer accused by Sir Francis Drake of witchcraft, mutiny and treason; beheaded

Name: Mary Eastey
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials

Name: Anna Eriksdotter
Death: The last person executed for sorcery in Sweden.

Name: Matteuccia de Francesco
Death: Confessed to having flown on the back of a demon; burned to death.

Name: Jeane Gardiner
Death: Executed in Bermuda.

Name: Gilles Garnier
Death: Serial child murderer; convicted of witchcraft and lycanthropy, and burned to death.

Name: Janet, Lady Glamis
Death: Accused of witchcraft by King James V; burned to death.

Name: Ann Glover
Death: Last person hanged for witchcraft in Boston.

Name: Peronne Goguillon
Death: Burned to death; one of the last women to be executed for witchcraft in France.

Name: Anna Göldi
Death: Beheaded; last person to be executed for withcraft in Europe[11]

Name: Sarah Good
Death: One of the first to be convicted in the Salem witch trials.

Name: Urbain Grandier
Death: Convicted following the Loudun possessions and burned to death.

Name: Goodwife Greensmith[7]
Death: Hanged at Hartford, Connecticut

Name: Bertrand Guilladot
Death: Priest who confessed to having made a pact with the devil

Name: Mechteld ten Ham
Death: Confessed under torture and was burned to death.

Name: Walpurga Hausmannin
Death: Midwife who confessed to child murder, witchcraft and vampirism; burned to death.

Name: Katharina Henot
Death: Postmistress; burned to death.

Name: Adrienne d'Heur
Death: Burned to death.

Name: Ann Hibbins
Death: The fourth person executed for witchcraft in Massachusetts Bay Colony; hanged on Boston Common

Name: Mary Hicks
Death: Mary and her daughter Elizabeth were to be the last Witches executed in England in Huntingdon.[12]

Name: Janet Horne
Death: Last British person to be executed for sorcery; burned to death.[citation needed]

Name: Elin i Horsnäs
Death: Beheaded after her second trial for witchcraft.

Name: Elizabeth Howe
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials.

Name: George Jacobs
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials.

Name: Mary Johnson
Death: Hanged at Hartford, Connecticut

Name: Margaret Jones
Death: The first person to be executed for witchcraft in Massachusetts Bay Colony; hanged.

Name: Evaline Gill
Death: Strangled; burned to death survived by 2 children moved to Singer Louisiana – Still living witch's Scalloway

Name: Märet Jonsdotter
Death: Beheaded

Name: Johannes Junius
Death: Tortured, burned to death during the Bamberg witch trials

Name: Ursula Kemp
Death: Confessed to witchcraft and hanged.

Name: Mrs. Kendall[7]
Death: Hanged at Cambridge, Massachusetts.

Name: Goodwife Knapp[13]
Death: Hanged at Fairfield, Connecticut.

Name: Anna Koldings
Death: Burned to death.

Name: Kolgrim
Death: Burned to death.

Name: Christenze Kruckow
Death: Noblewoman who confessed to cursing the marital bed of a rival; beheaded.

Name: Alice Lake[7]
Death: Wife of Henry Lake; hanged in Massachusetts.

Name: Guirandana de Lay
Death: Woman accused of witchcraft; burned at the stake.

Name: Leatherlips
Death: Native American leader who was sentenced to death for witchcraft and executed with a tomahawk.[14]

Name: Rebecca Lemp
Death: One of 32 women convicted of witchcraft in a witch hunt in Nördlingen, burnt at the stake.[15]

Name: Anne Løset
Death: Burned to death.

Name: Laurien Magee
Death: Burnt at the stake as part of the Islandmagee witch trial.[16]

Name: Susannah Martin
Death: Executed during the Salem witch trials.

Name: Malin Matsdotter
Death: Burned to death.

Name: Petronilla de Meath
Death: Burned to death.

Name: Rebecca Nurse
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials

Name: Alice Nutter
Death: Hanged during Pendle witches hunt

Name: Lisbeth Nypan
Death: Cunning woman accused of making people sick to earn money; burned to death.

Name: Ruth Osborne
Death: Murdered by an unruly mob during a "trial by ducking".

Name: Paisley witches
Death: Also known as the Bargarran witches, the last mass execution for witchcraft in western Europe.[17]

Name: Anne Palles
Death: The last person officially executed for witchcraft in Denmark; beheaded.

Name: Pappenheimer Family
Death: Tortured and burned to death.

Name: Alice Parker
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials.

Name: Mary Parker
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials.

Name: Maria Pauer
Death: Last person executed for witchcraft in Austria; beheaded.

Name: Anne Pedersdotter
Death: Burned to death.

Name: Elisabeth Plainacher
Death: Only person to be executed for witchcraft in Vienna; burned to death.

Name: Polissena of San Macario
Death: Burned to death.

Name: John Proctor
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials.

Name: Ann Pudeator
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials.

Name: Marketta Punasuomalainen
Death: Cunning woman, burned to death.

Name: Wilmot Redd
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials.

Name: Elspeth Reoch
Death: Executed in Kirkwall

Name: Catherine Repond
Death: Strangled and burned to death.

Name: Isabella Rigby
Death: Believed to be the last person hanged for witchcraft in Lancashire.[citation needed]

Name: Jòn Rögnvaldsson
Death: Burned to death.

Name: Anna Roleffes
Death: Decapitated and burned on December 30th, 1663. She was one of the last witches to be executed in Braunschweig, Germany and the complete account of her trial still exists. She is better known as Tempel Anneke.

Name: Maria Renata Saenger von Mossau
Death: One of the last to be executed for witchcraft in Germany.

Name: Agnes Sampson
Death: Midwife, garrotted and burned to death during the North Berwick witch trials.

Name: Margaret Scott
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials.

Name: Soulmother of Küssnacht
Death: Burned to death.

Name: Gyde Spandemager
Death: Burned to death.

Name: Maren Spliid
Death: Burned to death.

Name: Gentile Budrioli
Death: Tortured and burned on the stake in Bologna.

Name: Stedelen
Death: Confessed under torture to summoning demons; burned to death.

Name: Agnes Waterhouse
Death: The first woman executed for witchcraft in England; hanged.

Name: Thomas Weir
Death: Strangled and burned to death.

Name: Sarah Wildes
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials.

Name: John Willard
Death: Hanged during the Salem witch trials.

Name: Witches of Belvoir
Death: A mother and two daughters, the daughters were hanged.

Name: Witches of Warboys
Death: Alice Samuel and her family; hanged.

Name: Alse Young
Death: The first person recorded to have been executed for witchcraft in the American colonies; hanged.

Name: Barbara Zdunk
Death: Burned to death.

Name: Anna Zippel
Death: Beheaded for abducting children.

Name: Antti Tokoi
Death: Accused and convicted of witchcraft, blasphemy, disgracing priests, and healing.[citation needed]

Name: Brita Zippel
Death: Beheaded for sorcery.

Name: Jacob Distelzweig
Death: Impaled and drowned. Believed to bewitch men, causing them to have intercourse with him.

Name: Mima Renard
Death: Prostitute, was accused by popular belief to bewitch men; burned to death.

Name: Maria  da Conceição
Death: Accused and convicted of witchcraft to produce medicines and potions to attract men.

Name: Ursulina de Jesus
Death: Accused of removing her husband's virility to avoid having children; burned to death.

Name: Franziska Soder
Death: Burned as a witch. Her husband paid 320 Gulden as "confiscation" to the Gentlemen' Chamber in Rheinfelden.[18]

Name: Margaret Inne Quaine & John Cubbon[19]
Death: Executed in Castletown, Isle of Man with her son, John Cubbon.  Margaret's mother was also accused of Witchcraft several decades prior. Wiccan Priest Gerald Gardner erected a plaque in their memory on the Smelt Monument in Castletown Square.

Name: Ama Hemmah
Death: Accused of being a witch; burned to death.

Name: Amina bint Abdulhalim Nassar
Death: Public execution by beheading[20]

Name: Muree bin Ali Al Asiri
Death: Public execution by beheading[21]
